Class KMeansClusterer

java.lang.Object
KMeansClusterer
public class KMeansClusterer extends Object
KMeansClusterer.java - a JUnit-testable interface for the Model AI Assignments k-Means Clustering exercises.

      Returns:
      a double[][] with each row being a data point and each column being a dimension of the data

      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • getDim

      public int getDim()
      Return the number of dimensions of the clustering data.
      Returns:
      the number of dimensions of the clustering data

    • setKRange

      public void setKRange(int kMin, int kMax)
      Set the minimum and maximum allowable number of clusters k. If a single given k is to be used, then kMin == kMax. If kMin < kMax, then all k from kMin to kMax inclusive will be compared using the gap statistic. The minimum WCSS run of the k with the maximum gap will be the result.
      Parameters:
      kMin - minimum number of clusters
      kMax - maximum number of clusters

    • getK

      public int getK()
      Return the number of clusters k. After calling kMeansCluster() with a range from kMin to kMax, this value will be the k yielding the maximum gap statistic.
      Returns:
      the number of clusters k.

    • setIter

      public void setIter(int iter)
      Set the number of iterations to perform k-Means Clustering and choose the minimum WCSS result.
      Parameters:
      iter - the number of iterations to perform k-Means Clustering

    • getCentroids

      public double[][] getCentroids()
      Return the array of centroids indexed by cluster number and centroid dimension.
      Returns:
      the array of centroids indexed by cluster number and centroid dimension.

    • getClusters

      public int[] getClusters()
      Return a parallel array of cluster assignments such that data[i] belongs to the cluster clusters[i] with centroid centroids[clusters[i]].
      Returns:
      a parallel array of cluster assignments

    • getWCSS

      public double getWCSS()
      Return the minimum Within-Clusters Sum-of-Squares measure for the chosen k number of clusters.
      Returns:
      the minimum Within-Clusters Sum-of-Squares measure

    • assignNewClusters

      public boolean assignNewClusters()
      Assign each data point to the nearest centroid and return whether or not any cluster assignments changed.
      Returns:
      whether or not any cluster assignments changed

    • computeNewCentroids

      public void computeNewCentroids()
      Compute new centroids at the mean point of each cluster of points.

    • kMeansCluster

      public void kMeansCluster()
      Perform k-means clustering with Forgy initialization and return the 0-based cluster assignments for corresponding data points. If iter > 1, choose the clustering that minimizes the WCSS measure. If kMin < kMax, select the k maximizing the gap statistic using 100 uniform samples uniformly across given data ranges.

    • writeClusterData

      public void writeClusterData(String filename)
      Export cluster data in the given data output format to the file provided.
      Parameters:
      filename - the destination file

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Read UNIX-style command line parameters to as to specify the type of k-Means Clustering algorithm applied to the formatted data specified. "-k int" specifies both the minimum and maximum number of clusters. "-kmin int" specifies the minimum number of clusters. "-kmax int" specifies the maximum number of clusters. "-iter int" specifies the number of times k-Means Clustering is performed in iteration to find a lower local minimum. "-in filename" specifies the source file for input data. "-out filename" specifies the destination file for cluster data.
      Parameters:
      args - command-line parameters specifying the type of k-Means Clustering
